case_title: Ashwani Kumar Jain vs CEGAT, New Delhi
reference_no_or_id: Civil Misc Writ Petition No. 2172 of 2002
case_number: Civil Misc Writ Petition No. 2172 of 2002

accussed_details.name: Ashwani Kumar Jain
allegation: Failure to deposit penalty amount exceeding Rs. 4.5 Crores

complaint_summary: Petitioner challenged the order of Customs Excise and Gold (Control) Appellate Tribunal dated 22.4.2002 regarding partial waiver of pre-deposit for penalty.
investigation_summary: Tribunal directed petitioner No. 1 to deposit Rs. 20,00,000/- and petitioner No. 2 to deposit Rs. 5,00,000/- while waiving the remaining penalty and duty for appeal hearing.

judgment_summary.summary: The court found no error in the Tribunal's order and dismissed the writ petition, stating there was no merit in the case.

legal_arguments: Petitioner argued that the penalty imposed was excessive.
Respondent argued that the Tribunal had considered the facts and circumstances and provided partial waiver appropriately.
key_issues: Whether the Tribunal's order for partial waiver of pre-deposit was justified.

legal_terms.pre-deposit: A mandatory deposit required before proceeding with an appeal.

words_and_phrases.waiver: The act of relinquishing a right or claim.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the challenge to a Tribunal order granting partial waiver of pre-deposit for penalty. The court upheld the Tribunal's decision and dismissed the writ petition.
